info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 5:04AM CDT until July 6 at 11:57PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas...
San Saba River At San Saba affecting San Saba County.
For the San Saba River...including Brady, San Saba...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...San Saba River at San Saba.
* WHEN...From this morning to late Sunday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Major flooding will occur. Roads and low water crossings will be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 3.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 32.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.0 feet on 09/13/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE SUNDAY EVENING
